alert.note: Alert for Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 5:35AM CDT until July 23 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Lake IL County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 535 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms late last night into early this morning had produced heavy rain in portions of central and eastern Lake County. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen and additional scattered thunderstorms will occur early this morning. Flash flooding is already occurring on roadways, as reported by law enforcement, especially in and near Lake Bluff. With daybreak, the risk of motorists to encounter flooded roads or streams has increased. HAZARD...Significant flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, drainage ditches, and urban areas. Possible flooding of structures. Widespread roadway flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waukegan, North Chicago, Gurnee, Mundelein, Highland Park, Vernon Hills, Zion, Grayslake, Libertyville, Lake Forest, Round Lake, Beach Park, Gages Lake, Hawthorn Woods, Park City, Round Lake Park, Lake Bluff, Highwood, Green Oaks and Wadsworth. Skokie River, Bull Creek, and immediate tributaries to the Des Plaines River, FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, canals, and storm sewers, as well roadways, underpasses, and other poor drainage areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Consider not traveling early this morning.
